description: Extension of planning permission ref 17/14480/HOU (Erection of extension to front of garage and increased height of roof) dated 12/07/2017.
decision_conditions: By reason of the application's submission date of 8 December 2020 and expiry date of 6 January 2021, the proposal is considered not to benefit from the legislation and would conflict with Part 3, Section 17, Paragraph 12 of Section 93B of the Business and Planning Act 2020.

Condition 3 (Materials) of planning permission 22/03096/HOU  states: Notwithstanding the submitted information in relation to facing materials, prior to the carrying out of any above ground works, other than demolition, details of the facing materials to be utilised in the development hereby permitted shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.While the proposed brick and roof tiles are considered to be acceptable, no details of the proposed aluminium cladding and capping has been submitted so officers are unable to assess how the proposed facing material would relate to the character and appearance of the host building and the conservation area. As such it is considered that insufficient information has been submitted to discharge condition 3.

PLEASE READ CAREFULLY:On the 1st May 2024 the Council adopted a new Validation Local List. Please ensure that your application submission includes all the necessary documentation as required by the new local list. Then please complete and submit a Validation Checklist - Section 3. The new Validation  Local List and checklists can be obtained via the council's website: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applicationsThe LPA will not conduct any validation checks until the correct Checklist has been submitted. Upon receipt of a completed Checklist, the application will be assigned to a validation officer to review. Please do not simply state N/A in the checklist without a written justification.If you need to make any changes to your application please try to do this via the Planning Portal website where possible. If that is not possible please send amended documents via the email address quoted in this letter.
